info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 7:46PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Carroll and southeastern Stephenson Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 746 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm over Freeport, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Freeport, German Valley, Ridott, Winneshiek, Albertus Airport, Bolton, and Stephenson County Fairgrounds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
